comments: Contribution from _Wolfdieter Lang_, Nov 08 2010: (Start)a(n)/A056982(n) = -(binomial(2*n,n)^2)/((2*n-1)*2^(4*n)), n>=0, are the coefficients of x^n of hypergeometric([1/2,-1/2],[1],x).The series hypergeometric([1/2,-1/2],[1],e^2)=L/(2*Pi*a) with L the perimeter of an ellipse with major axis a and numerical eccentricity e. (End)
formula: a(n) = 2^(-2 w[n])binomial[2n, n]^2 (-1)^(2n)/(1-2n) with w[n]=A000120 = number of 1's in binary expansion of n
author: _Wouter Meeussen_, revised Jan 03 2001
